intro: Ardisia letestui, commonly known as the Sierra Leone ardisia, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of West Africa. It belongs to the family Myrsinaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, red berries that are often consumed by birds. The plant typically grows as an understory shrub, thriving in humid, shaded environments with well-drained soil. Its botanical features include opposite leaf arrangement and showy, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. Ardisia letestui is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
